Info.name: Info
Info.description: Contains information about the specified language

params.name: langCode
params.description: Language ISO693-2 code: ara, jpn, eng, etc.

params.name: langCode
params.description: the code of the language: ara, jpn, etc.

classitems.description: Transform from Arabic numbers to Arabic letters
classitems.name: toArabicLetters

classitems.description: Arabic to morse normalization
classitems.name: ar2morseNormalize

classitems.description: pre-transliteration for morse: cleaning non supported codes
classitems.name: morsePreTrans

classitems.description: post-transliteration for morse: clean non morse characters
classitems.name: morsePostTrans

classitems.description: pre-untransliteration for morse: clean non morse characters
classitems.name: morsePreUntrans

classitems.description: post-untransliteration for morse
classitems.name: morsePostUntrans

Transform from Arabic numbers to Japanese letters
classitems.name: toJapaneseLetters

classitems.description: kunreiShiki pre-transliteration function
classitems.name: kunreiShikiPreTrans

classitems.description: kunreiShiki pre-untransliteration function
classitems.name: kunreiShikiPreUntrans

classitems.description: Replace the doubled characters with a little "tsu" if different from "n"
classitems.name: doubleReplace

return.description: The same string but the repeated characters are replaced

classitems.description: Transform xya to Japanese little 'tsu' followed by ya
classitems.name: xya2Jap

return.description: text with xya transformed to Japanese

classitems.description: Replace the lone characters with their equivalent + "u"
classitems.name: loneCharReplace

classitems.description: Get the name of the language
classitems.name: getName

return.description: the language name: arabic, english, japanese, etc.

classitems.description: Get the code of the language
classitems.name: getCode

classitems.description: Get the family of the language
classitems.name: getFamily

return.description: The language family: Afro-asiatic, Japonic, etc.

classitems.description: Get the branch of the language, if any
classitems.name: getBranch

classitems.description: Get the direction of writing of the language: ltr or rtl
classitems.name: getDir

return.description: The language direction: left to right (ltr) or right to left (rtl)

classitems.description:
Get the words order:
  • s: Subject
  • v: Verb
  • o: Object
For example, English is "svo"
classitems.name: getWordOrder

return.description: The words order in the language

classitems.description: The number of population speaking the language
classitems.name: getPopulation

classitems.description: Contries where this language is official
classitems.name: getLocations

return.description: Array of strings with contries names

classitems.description: Get the Dialects
classitems.name: getDialects

classitems.description:
Contains the super-classes: Info, Lang, Trans, Morpho.
for example, JsLingua.Cls.Info returns Info class
classitems.name: Cls

classitems.description: Add a service for a specific language
classitems.name: addService

params.name: theClass
params.description: The class that affords the service

classitems.description: Get the codes of available languages of a given service
classitems.name: serviceLanguages

params.name: serviceID
params.description: The name of the service (the super-classe): "Info", "Lang", etc.

return.description: array of strings, with ISO639-2 codes

classitems.description:
Get the service class for a given language and service name.
For example: JsLingua.getService("Info", "ara") Gives a class AraInfo
classitems.name: getService

params.name: serviceID
params.description: The name of the service (the super-classe): "Info", "Lang", etc.

return.description: The class that affords the service

classitems.description: Returns unicode
classitems.name: getUnicode

params.name: char
params.description: a character or a unicode int

return.description: returns the same number or the unicode of the first character

classitems.description:
Returns another method to verify if a character's unicode is between
two unicode numbers min and max
classitems.name: isBetween

return.description: function with char as parameter and returns a boolean

classitems.description: Add char sets of a language
classitems.name: addCharSet

params.name: setName
params.description: CharSet name, for example: hiragana, kanji, Arabic suppliment

params.name: begin
params.description: integer value: begining of the charSet

params.name: end
params.description: integer value: end of the charSet

classitems.description: Creates a new transformation method
classitems.name: addTransform

params.name: transName
params.description: transformation name (function name), for example: hiragana2Katakana

params.name: offset
params.description: the number we add to the char's unicodes to get the new character

classitems.description: Returns the available charsets for the current language
classitems.name: availableCharSets

return.description: a set of strings containing the names of charsets

classitems.description: Returns the available transformations for the current language
classitems.name: availableTransformations

return.description: a set of strings containing the names of transformation functions

classitems.description: Returns the transformation function
classitems.name: transformationFunction

params.name: transName
params.description: transformation name (function name), for example: hiragana2Katakana

return.description: a function which takes a string and transforme it to another string with different charset

classitems.description: Returns a function which verifies if a char belongs to a charset or not
classitems.name: verifyCharSetFunction

params.name: setName
params.description: CharSet name, for example: hiragana, kanji, Arabic suppliment

return.description: A function which takes a char and returns true if it belongs to the charset

classitems.description: Returns a function which verifies if a string contains at least one character which belongs to a charset
classitems.name: containsCharSetFunction

params.name: setName
params.description: CharSet name, for example: hiragana, kanji, Arabic suppliment

return.description: A function which takes a string and returns true if one of its characters belongs to the charset

classitems.description: Returns a function which verifies if all string's characters belong to a charset
classitems.name: allCharSetFunction

params.name: setName
params.description: CharSet name, for example: hiragana, kanji, Arabic suppliment

return.description: A function which takes a string and returns true if all of its characters belong to the charset

classitems.description: Returns the code of the language
classitems.name: getCode

classitems.description:
A function which returns the pronounciation of a number in the destination
language (this must be overriden)
classitems.name: pronounceNumber

params.name: num
params.description: A number to be transformed into letters

classitems.description:
The part of speech: Noun, Verb, Adjective,
Adverb, Preposition, Pronoun
classitems.name: PoS

classitems.description: The tense: Past, Present, Future
classitems.name: Tense

classitems.description: The aspect: Simple, Continuous, Perfect, PerfectContinuous
classitems.name: Aspect

classitems.description:
The mood: Indicative, Subjunctive, Conditional,
Optative, Imperative, Jussive, Potential,
Hypothetical, Inferential
classitems.name: Mood

classitems.description: The voice: Active,Passive, Middle
classitems.name: Voice

classitems.description: The number: Singular, Dual, Plural
classitems.name: Num

classitems.description:
The case: Nominative, Accusative, Genitive, Dative,
Prepositional, Ablative, Instrumental, Vocative
classitems.name: Case

classitems.description: The person: First, Second, Third.
classitems.name: Person

classitems.description: The gender: Masculine, Feminine, Neuter.
classitems.name: Gender

classitems.description:
This is a map to different morphology features:
  • POS
  • Tense
  • Aspect
  • Mood
  • Voice
  • Number: It returns Num
  • Case: It returns Case
  • Person: It returns Person
  • Gender: It returns Gender
We can access these features either by:
Morpho.Feature.feature_name
Or:
Morpho.Feature["feature_name"]
classitems.name: Feature

classitems.description: This method is used to recover the name of the tense

params.name: tense
params.description: the tense which we want to get the name

return.description: the name of the tense in the selected language

classitems.description: This method is used to get personal pronouns characteristics
classitems.name: getPronounOpts

classitems.description: This function returns an array of available tenses
classitems.name: getTenses

return.description: Array of tenses available for the language

classitems.description: This function is used for verb conjugation
classitems.name: conjugate

params.name: opts
params.description: options for tense, case, voice, aspect, person, number, gender, mood, and other

classitems.description:
Get the personal pronoun using options like: person, gender, etc.
for example, the parameters for the personal pronoun "I":
``` { person: Morpho.Feature.Person.First, number: Morpho.Feature.Number.Singular } ```
classitems.name: getPronounName

params.name: opts
params.description: An object containing parameters: person, gender, number.

classitems.description:
This function is used for noun inflexion
For example: noun to plural nouns
classitems.name: declenseNoun

classitems.description: Stem a word: delete prefixes, suffixes and infixes
classitems.name: stem

classitems.description: lemmatize a word: return it to its origin
classitems.name: lemmatize

classitems.description:
Read morse code and output as sound
Example: readMorse("..-. .-- ..-.");
classitems.name: readMorse

params.name: morse
params.description: morse code written using ".", "-" and blacks " ".

classitems.description:
Transform HTML reserved characters to their equivalent codes in HTML.
for example: "<" is transformed to "<".
classitems.name: htmlEntities

classitems.description: This function returns another function which do the transformation
classitems.name: getTransliterator

params.name: srcTbl
params.description: array which contains the source strings

params.name: dstTbl
params.description: array which contains the destination strings

return.description:
a function which takes a string and transforme it using
srcTbl and dstTbl

classitems.description: Add new transliteration method using two parallele tables
classitems.name: newMethod

params.name: langTbl
params.description: array of strigs, the languages characters

params.name: transTbl
params.description: array of strigs, their respective representations

classitems.description: Set transliteration methods directly
classitems.name: setTransUntrasMethods

classitems.description: add pre- and post-transliteration functions to a method
classitems.name: addTransPrePostMethods

params.name: preFunc
params.description:
function that executes before transliteration;
It takes a string and returns a string

params.name: postFunc
params.description:
function that executes after transliteration;
It takes a string and returns a string

classitems.description: add pre- and post-untransliteration functions to a method
classitems.name: addUntransPrePostMethods

params.name: preFunc
params.description:
function that executes before untransliteration;
It takes a string and returns a string

params.name: postFunc
params.description:
function that executes after untransliteration;
It takes a string and returns a string

classitems.description: Sets the current method to be used for [un]transliteration
classitems.name: setCurrentMethod

classitems.description: Returns the list of available transliteration methods
classitems.name: availableMethods

return.description: Array of Strings containing methods names

classitems.description: gets the language's code
classitems.name: getCode

classitems.description: transliterate the text using the current method
classitems.name: transliterate

classitems.description: untransliterate the text using the current method
classitems.name: untransliterate
